intro: Sisymbrium himalaicum, commonly known as Himalayan tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and features yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Sisymbrium himalaicum is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
